0.Pros: meeting new people is always good
0.Cons: The service is not always very good

1.Pros: Good part time hoursCo-workers were nice
1.Cons: High turnoverNot good trainingJob responsibilities not well defined

2.Cons: long shifts, rude customers, horrible wages

3.Pros: Good hours if you're willing to work them, learn to handle all types of customers.
3.Cons: Low respect from customers. Dirty working enviorment.

4.Pros: great uniform, cool mascot, fun people, free french fries
4.Cons: smells, hard to move up, long hours

5.Cons: Too much labor for too little pay. No respect

6.Pros: Easy startup"training"Become great at multitasking50% discount
6.Cons: Always busyAlways on your feetHaving to eat McDonald's all the time... gaining weight (ha)Free soft drinks equals sugar for days

7.Pros: If your into manual labor and like to work solo this is for you. You answer only to your District, Store, and General Managers(Sometimes).
7.Cons: Individuals seem to attempt to take advantage. As a new employee I was generous at lending helping hands to all crew members when food preparations and things were needed. Yet, whenever I asked for help as far as Stocking the freezer when the truck drops, repairs around the store that needed an extra pair of legs or a back. Each said I am busy when they clearly were not. Others have even told me that is not my job. I stopped being so helpful at that point only when approached politely and it would not affect my work.

8.Pros: When I was in college, this was an awesome part time job..great with flexibility..

9.Pros: Rewarding learning experience being a fry cook at Mcdonald's. Lot of upward momentum when cooking the fries. Learned a lot.
9.Cons: If you can not take the heat then get out of the kitchen. that is the motto for a fry cook to have when working at mcdonalds.
